CatDescriptText: Mr. James Wilson, porter, 1826 Diaz Way, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you believe in divorce even though most religious groups frown upon it, and some actually ban it except under very extenuating circumstances?" answer reads: "Yes. If people cannot get along, it's more than right for them to put an end to their married life."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James Wilson wearing light colored trench coat with striped lining and dark zippered jacket with light colored trim, standing with toothpick in mouth, in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
